page.title: 04LANDCOVER.RECLAMATION.
page.content: Our twelve squares cover an area of Kidsgrove that have been used for coal mining iron ore exploitation and other minor mineral workings such as sand and rock quarrying. As a result of this mining the area is absolutely covered with derelict land,old mine shafts and ancillary buildings. Large areas of land in kidsgrove have not been deliberately reclaimed but have acquired a natural appearance. In Kidsgrove the largest reclamation scheme is at Birchenwood where open cast mining took place. The Loop line that fed B'wood is to be made into a walkway. Other derelict land in Kidsgrove has been reclaimed as sports fields and an adult training centre eg.Gloucester Rd.
